packages.name: Starter — 3 sessions
packages.scope: One micro-experiment between sessions; CV/LinkedIn quick pass for UK norms.
packages.price_note: Fees on request; invoiced in GBP.

packages.name: Focus — 6 sessions
packages.scope: Portfolio/CV reframing with visible proof points; interview rehearsal for clarity and fit.
packages.price_note: Fees on request; invoiced in GBP.

packages.name: Extended — 12 sessions
packages.scope: Deep practice on culture fit and manager conversations; tailored projects with rhythm reviews.
packages.price_note: Fees on request; invoiced in GBP.

policies.title: Rescheduling
policies.body: 24 hours’ notice; late changes count as used.

policies.title: Cadence
policies.body: Cadence agreed in the first session; pause allowed between blocks.

policies.title: Confidentiality
policies.body: Confidential by default; minimal notes; deletion on request.

policies.title: Scope
policies.body: Coaching, not therapy — signposting if therapy is safer.

checklist: 50–60 minutes available; quiet place and stable connection.
UK hours workable; calendar ready for weekly cadence.
A situation to test (role/field/city) or one question you care about.
Comfortable with coaching boundaries; no crisis topics.
Willing to run one micro-experiment before the next session.
LinkedIn URL or latest CV ready to share.
Consent to minimal notes and data handling per policy.
If English is not first language: okay to pause/clarify.
Able to use Google Docs/Sheets and Zoom/Meet.
what_to_prepare: Your LinkedIn URL or a recent CV (PDF).
Two short examples you’re proud of — what you did and why it matters.
A rough weekly rhythm that could work for you.
Top 3 questions you want answered in the first two sessions.
signals: You prefer calm, honest guidance without hype.
You’re okay with small experiments that may fail.
You want UK-relevant proof points, not generic advice.
You can keep a weekly cadence with short reviews.
You’re comfortable with “coaching, not therapy” scope.

process.title: Process & milestones
process.description: We usually partner for eight to ten sessions across three months with optional co-working sprints.

steps.title: Map the hiring landscape
steps.description: We unpack sector norms, sponsorship realities and what evidence UK employers seek.

steps.title: Build your narrative toolkit
steps.description: We co-write scripts, portfolio stories and Q&A to use with recruiters, hiring managers and networks.

steps.title: Sustain the search
steps.description: We monitor energy, iterate weekly plans and celebrate momentum so you do not burn out.

process.note: You can add document reviews or mock interviews between sessions when deadlines appear.

sections.title: Scope & Fit
paragraphs: This is coaching, not therapy, counselling, immigration or legal advice.
We work on UK-relevant proof points, clear stories, preparation and cadence.
If therapy or legal advice is safer, we will signpost appropriate services.

sections.title: Confidentiality
paragraphs: Sessions are confidential by default.
Only minimal notes are kept; you may request deletion at any time.
We may discuss anonymised patterns in supervision for quality, without identifying details.

sections.title: Scheduling & Rescheduling
paragraphs: Standard session length is ~50 minutes, online, within UK hours.
24 hours’ notice is required to reschedule; late changes count as used.
Blocks may pause between sessions by mutual agreement to protect cadence and rest.

sections.title: Fees & Invoicing
paragraphs: Fees are in GBP. Invoices are issued for each block or as agreed.
Delivered sessions are non-refundable. Unused sessions in a block can be paused.
Any bank or platform charges are borne by the client unless otherwise agreed.

sections.title: Data & Records
paragraphs: We keep the minimum necessary data to run sessions and invoices.
You can request a copy or deletion of personal data subject to legal limits.
We use common tools (e.g., Google Docs/Sheets, email, video platforms) with reasonable care.

sections.title: Fair Use & Boundaries
paragraphs: Between sessions, light check-ins are fine; heavy review or done-for-you work is out of scope.
We do not contact employers on your behalf, nor provide visa/legal advice.
If there is risk of harm, confidentiality may be lifted to keep people safe.

sections.title: Disputes
paragraphs: We aim to resolve issues early via email and a short call.
If unresolved, we will propose a simple written plan and a pause if needed.
UK law and forums apply unless otherwise required by mandatory local law.

items.q: Do you guarantee a job or interview?
items.a: No. Coaching is not placement. We help you create UK-relevant proof points and clearer stories, then you apply and track results.

items.q: What language are sessions delivered in?
items.a: English. We can slow down, clarify, and write together. If needed, we can switch briefly to Chinese for tricky concepts.

items.q: Can you advise on visas or immigration law?
items.a: No legal advice. We work with your constraints and signpost official resources where appropriate.

items.q: Will you write my CV or LinkedIn for me?
items.a: You own the words. We coach the structure, clarity, and UK norms; we can suggest edits together on Google Docs.

items.q: Will you contact employers or recruiters on my behalf?
items.a: No. We help you build outreach scripts and confidence, but you contact people directly.

items.q: How much between-session work is expected?
items.a: Usually 30–60 minutes a week (one micro-experiment: info chat, trial task, volunteering taster). Keep it small and visible.
Yes. Confidential by default; minimal notes; deletion on request. See boundaries page for details.
24-hour notice for rescheduling; late changes count as used. No refunds for delivered sessions; blocks can pause between sessions.

cases.title: Composite coaching glimpses
cases.description: Examples anonymised across internationally trained professionals navigating the UK market.

items.title: Sponsorship status anxiety
items.context: Non-UK degree; unsure how to address visa sponsorship early.
items.coaching_moves: Built a 2-line sponsorship script; prioritised target firms by policy; planned 10-day outreach.
items.shift: Fewer ghosted threads; clearer yes/no signals faster.
items.disclaimer: Illustrative and anonymised; outcomes are not promised.

items.title: Translating overseas wins
items.context: Strong results abroad not mapping to UK bullets.
items.coaching_moves: Converted two projects to UK-style metrics; created proof links; rehearsed succinct framing.
items.shift: Hiring managers understood scope without over-explaining.
items.disclaimer: Illustrative and anonymised; outcomes are not promised.

items.title: Accent & confidence
items.context: Avoids phone screens due to accent worries.
items.coaching_moves: Practised slow-first phrasing; scripted clarifying questions; built pause habits.
items.shift: Entered calls with steadier pace and fewer rush-talk loops.
items.disclaimer: Illustrative and anonymised; outcomes are not promised.

items.title: Translate overseas experience into UK-relevant examples and terms.
Weekly cadence; micro-experiments between sessions (info chats, trial tasks, volunteering taster).
CV/LinkedIn adapted to UK norms; show recent proof points.
Interview rehearsal for culture/fit—clear stories without scripts or hacks.
Simple pricing; pause between blocks; confidentiality by default.

title: Immigrant job search — coaching pathway
description: Turn experience into UK-relevant proof points. CV/LinkedIn clarity, outreach scripts, interview practice.
